availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Walter de B. Morrill (Kentucky, notary, soldier (U.S.A.))

body.p: Kentucky, notary, soldier. Meriden, New Hampshire native. Born Richard Baxter Morrill. Married to Mary J. Nutter Morrill on October 11, 1845. Father of Daniel Morrill, Lettie Morrill, Edd Morrill, Paul Morrill, and John Morrill. Attended Kimball Union Academy in Plainfield, New Hampshire from 1839 to 1843. Served as quartermaster of the 74th Illinois Infantry Regiment from 1863 to 1865. Served as colonel and military agent at Louisville, Kentucky in 1864. Real estate broker in Kentucky in 1865. Nominated notary public for Kentucky at large on December 9, 1865.

ab.bibl:
